intro: Martiusia mariana, commonly known as the American martiusia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist, acidic soils. It produces showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are ovate with a smooth margin and can reach up to 10 centimeters in length.
